reviews.text: asking me to mandatorily link my Square Enix account wasn’t a great sign
the UI is sluggish; even during the premium shop portions
I actually really enjoyed many aspects of the story
Visually, Babylon’s Fall has gotten a little better since the shaky reveal, but it’s still rough, especially with character models
When you’re actually fighting stuff, it’s a ton of fun
many of them look the same... same enemies, slightly tweaked
the menus are a big point of contention
Babylon’s Fall is $60, with a $99.99 digital deluxe edition
sound design that are trying to feel stylish, but stumble due to time constraints
hitting a fun wall when constantly doing the same things over and over
the game is almost impossible to recommend... plug pulled before the end of the year
the ability to equip vanity attire (transmog) shows that they cared about the design of how characters look
live service elements like daily login bonuses and battle passes
the menus are laborious to navigate
the core gameplay is fun but constrained by live service elements
